definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)
light bulb/see also 電燈泡|电灯泡[dian4 deng1 pao4]/third-wheel or unwanted third party spoiling a couple's date (slang)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to run a red light/failing to stop at a red traffic light/(slang) to have sex with a girl while she is menstruating
colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
carnival during the Lantern Festival, with lantern displays and traditional folk performances such as stilt walking and lion dance

sentences.english: Next door, Chueh-min struck a match and lit the oil lamp.
sentences.chinese: 在隔壁房间里觉民把火柴擦燃，点了灯。

sentences.english: Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.
sentences.chinese: 咒骂父母的，他的灯必灭，变为漆黑的黑暗。

sentences.english: It's a pretty good work lamp.
The red chairs, the lamps and the table are from the street.
sentences.chinese: 红椅子，灯和桌子是从街上捡来的。

sentences.english: Huagu Opera Art is a product of agricultural civilization.
sentences.chinese: 花鼓灯艺术是农耕文明的产物。

sentences.english: A single high brightness LED is enough.
sentences.chinese: 只要一个高亮度的LED灯就够了。

sentences.english: The star indeed was not lit that night.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上那盏星星灯确实没有点亮。

sentences.english: The light changed and they drove on, but Hannah was too young to be reasonable.
sentences.chinese: 灯变绿了他们继续开着，但是汉娜太小不知事理。

sentences.english: Then all the virgins woke up and trimmed their lamps.
sentences.chinese: 那些童女就都起来收拾灯。

sentences.english: The continuos high book shelf integrates lighting which position can be adjusted to the need.
sentences.chinese: 连续的高书架集成照明灯，灯的位置能够按需调节。

sentences.english: Tian An Men Square looks even more beautiful with all lights on.
sentences.chinese: 所有的灯都亮着，天安门广场显得更加漂亮。

sentences.english: Our instructor turned around to go back and turn the lights back on.
sentences.chinese: 我们的老师转身过去走到后面想把灯都打开。

sentences.english: During this check, the red brake warning lamp and the anti-lock warning lamp are illuminated.
sentences.chinese: 在这项检查中，红色制动警告灯和防抱死警告灯亮。

sentences.english: Megan closed the door behind them and turned the lights on.
sentences.chinese: 梅金走在最后面，是她关上了门，也是她开的灯。

sentences.english: The timed light always goes out before I can reach the landing.
sentences.chinese: 定时感应灯通常还没等我走到楼下就熄灭了。

sentences.english: Let's carve this pumpkin into a scary jocko'-lantern.
sentences.chinese: 我们把这个南瓜刻成一个吓人的南瓜灯。

definition: cover of lamp/lampshade/glass cover of oil lamp
dome light (of a taxi etc)/ceiling light (in a room)/interior light (of a car)/light on the top of a mast etc
to illuminate/to turn on the lights/to light (a blaze)
altar lamp burning day and night
